code: library(maybe)  safe_divide <- function(a, b) {   if (b == 0) nothing() else just(a / b) }  2 / 2 #> [1] 1 safe_divide(2, 2) #> Just #> [1] 1  2 / 0 #> [1] Inf safe_divide(2, 0) #> Nothing safe_divide(2, 2) #> Just #> [1] 1 safe_divide(2, 2) |> with_default(0) #> [1] 1  safe_divide(2, 0) #> Nothing safe_divide(2, 0) |> with_default(0) #> [1] 0 safe_divide(-2, 2) #> Just #> [1] -1 safe_divide(-2, 2) |> map_maybe(abs) #> Just #> [1] 1  safe_divide(-2, 0) #> Nothing safe_divide(-2, 0) |> map_maybe(abs) #> Nothing safe_mean <- function(a) {   if (length(a) == 0L) nothing() else just(mean(a)) }  safe_sqrt <- function(a) {   if (a == -1) nothing() else just(sqrt(a)) }  safe_mean(1:10) |> and_then(safe_sqrt) #> Just #> [1] 2.345208 safe_mean <- maybe(mean, ensure = not_nan) safe_sqrt <- maybe(sqrt, ensure = not_infinite)  safe_mean("hello") |> and_then(safe_sqrt) #> Nothing safe_mean(1:10) |> and_then(safe_sqrt) #> Just #> [1] 2.345208 safe_mean <- maybe(mean)  safe_mean(1:10) #> Nothing safe_mean("hello") #> Nothing  safe_mean <- maybe(mean, allow_warning = TRUE)  safe_mean("hello") #> Warning in mean.default(...): argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA #> [1] NA safe_mean <- perhaps(mean, otherwise = 0)  safe_mean(1:10) #> [1] 0 safe_mean("hello") #> [1] 0 safe_mean <- maybe(mean, ensure = and(not_nan, not_empty))  safe_mean(1:10) #> Just #> [1] 5.5 safe_mean <- maybe(mean, ensure = not_undefined)  safe_mean(c(1, 2, 3)) #> Just #> [1] 2 safe_mean(c(NA, 2, 3)) #> Nothing
